intro: Rhinanthus dinaricus, commonly known as the Dinaric yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its flowers are yellow and tubular, arranged in spikes, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Rhinanthus dinaricus is characterized by its reduced leaves and reliance on host plants for water and nutrients.
